sub_title: Facility and Security Systems Coordinator Europe
summary: A skilled and accomplished IT and Construction Manager, leading the implementation of diverse systems within numerous high-profile construction projects. Deliver focused instruction to staff at all levels, supporting the timely and cost-effective completion of operations, identifying and mitigating issues accordingly. Lead and develop capable teams, promoting autonomous working practices through effective training and coaching.

school.name: West Coast Institute of Management and Technology

profile_positions.description:
Built a strong and resilient network among our European locations and the IDEXX Facilities Operations Center based in Westbrook, Maine.
Coordinate the installation, upkeep and operation of surveillance and access control systems between European locations and Westbrook, Maine.
Coordinate the installation, upkeep and operation of other technologies including a mass-notification system, duty-of-care software, and visitor management programs, also identify and recommend new technologies across our European, and world-wide portfolio.
Recognize key players and proactively develop strong working relationships within the extended European team.
Apply a quantifiable risk assessment standard for all European locations to spotlight needs and opportunities, then use this assessment to benchmark locations.
•	Streamline and help guide a comprehensive and interlocked security program for Europe that addresses best practices and standard operating procedures.
Conduct investigations, mine data, and provide summary reports of findings and recommendations.
Own the Incident Command role for the IDEXX EMEA Headquarters; Oversee relevant planning, coordination, logistics, training, and tactical leadership. Emergencies may include material spills, medical responses, and security matters.
Primary liaison with outside law enforcement agencies, create opportunities to ensure familiarity with contacts and keep abreast of regulated security policies and procedures. Maintain the documentation necessary to validate compliance.
Positive influencer on topics like workplace violence, business disruption mitigation tactics, and Facilities Operations Center-driven initiatives.
Visit IDEXX facilities across Europe as necessary to provide on-site assistance, assessments, training, or other Facilities Operations Center obligations when needed.
Perform research, collect and mine data for analysis, conduct interviews in person and remotely, investigate incidents and draft associated reports.
profile_positions.title: Facility and Security Systems Coordinator; Europe.

profile_positions.description:
Instrumental part of project delivery across 4 areas: Communication, Building Related Systems, Security Systems and Airport Operational System works. Define and deliver scope of work, assessing design, shop drawings and as-built drawings, ensuring they remain fit for purpose, making amendments. Devise and execute testing, adhering to established codes of practice, delivering diverse progress reports across project lifecycle. Create RAMS, undertaking site visits to assess installation of equipment. 
•	Prepared delivery of Airport Pier, across entire lifecycle, working independently, coordinating design, attending client meetings, managing subcontracts and site installation 
•	Led and managed large team, managing performance
•	Built and nurtured strong client relationships, hosting regular meetings and site visits
•	Liaise with other professionals, harmonizing activities between Electrical, Mechanical and Architectural Engineering departments, directing seamless fabrication
•	Manage and negotiate contracts / sub contractual agreements, to project award, evaluating tenders.
•	Single point of contact for all Communication, Building Related Systems, Security Systems and Airport Operational System works for the project delivery and handover.
profile_positions.title: Master System Integrator (MSI Manager) Construction Delivery

profile_positions.description:
Managed the accurate and timely installation of civil, electrical and electronic requirements across sites, collaboratively defining installation needs and devising strategic plans, liaising with Employer and Airport Operation Teams, minimizing operational interruption. Oversaw multi-terminal operations, leading Aviation System Support Team, delivering focused training, managing handover. Undertook financial tasks, analysing costs and producing financial statements / reports, monitoring budget delivery and supporting future project forecasting.
•	Completed project within designated timeframes, securing cost savings of approximately 150K USD
•	Directed smooth handover of systems
•	Secured additional business, having provided exemplary client satisfaction
profile_positions.title: Business Development and Project Manager: Dammam International Airport Quick Wins Project

profile_positions.description:
Instrumental part of propelling construction activity forward on one of the largest screens in Riyadh Airport, working across 3 separate areas. Oversaw all installation works across site, creating and embedding focused plans, liaising with site staff as needed. 
•	Enabled IT team to initiate specific tasks, utilizing network on contacts
•	Recruited new subcontractor, raising efficiency and adherence to time constraints
•	Secured special recognition from Client, with specific correspondence sent to employer
profile_positions.title: Business Development and Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Led the delivery of IT, Security and ULV activities, administering scope of works and Method Statements, assessing shop and as-built drawings, adhering to design specifications. Oversaw costs, defining and managing budget, reporting on spends. Negotiated and analyzed contracts / subcontracts between diverse subcontractors. Managed the installation, testing and commissioning of Security requirements, overseeing the fabrication and implementation of 26 ULV and IT systems including Main and Backup Tier 3 Data Centers, synchronizing Electrical, Mechanical and Architectural Engineering Departments. Devised and reviewed QA\QC protocol, directing required inspections, identifying and rectifying issues. Led and directed substantial and capable team.
•	Secured 100% design approval, realizing significant savings of 10m USD, against project value of 1b USD
•	Achieved several internal awards, including Employee of the Month
•	Developed internal systems to automate the project, implementing ERP in the local environment for financial tasks 
•	Established remote meeting rooms for international discussions, reducing costs and travel time
profile_positions.title: Telecom, ULV and Security Design Manager: Aircraft Maintenance Hangers

profile_positions.description:
Led the team as Product development Manager for Physical Security and Building Automation systems. R&D of solutions, Business plans to develop new partnerships with manufacturers and vendors. Introduction of new solutions to company board of directors.

An Award-winning Bio-metric security solution for Bupa Middle East. A self-service (kiosk based) fully automated system that revolutionized the health Insurance security market. Managed project from Kiosk design and customization, site testing and commissioning, developed and managed the project. Lead team of US Bio-metric software engineers and developers to fully automate the solution for customer ID security and process automation.
profile_positions.title: Product Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
MSI for Special Airport and Security systems, technical training to the engineers, system designs, implementation, integration, planning and management of Biometrics, CCTV, Fire Alarm and Public Address and Evacuation system (IP and analog based solutions), IRIS, Access control system and various other security related technology projects.
●	Exhibited strong managerial traits, and the ability to serve as an effective leader.
●	Fostered Information and Communication Technologies in team.
●	Maintained a positive attitude despite any hurdles.
●	Brought forth empathy and a constant consideration of the perspective of colleagues and business partners.
●	Worked in collaboration with other team members to achieve success.
●	Brought forth the ability to plan and effectively manage time.
●	Worked well in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
●	Worked to build long-term relationships with company stakeholders.
●	Effectively participated in cross-team strategizing efforts to achieve optimal goals.
●	Worked well independently and on a team to solve problems.
Managed scheming the blueprint and the deployment of a new IP Network infrastructure for the whole group of companies in 120+ branches that included Nissan Saudi Arabia, Fuchs ME, Alhamrani Universal (Diebold ME), and 7 more local group companies.

Stipulated the installation of Wireless devices integrating high speed connections to the existing network.  Pioneered the configuration of Motorola Vanguard Routers (64xx, 320 and 340 series) into the current Network. Later migrated to 3COM on core and distribution level. 

Engineered the backbone of all network resources to access systems, Intranet and in addition of providing VPN and terminal server access for the remote locations with Encrypted means to ensure further data security.
profile_positions.title: Master System Integrator

profile_positions.description:
1.E.R.P Standards for all the companies in the group.
Different companies using different software for business management and with corporate level their consolidation was a real challenge. Solution to this problem to bring them on a standard E.R.P Platform for consolidation and administration. Baan for non-automotive companies. Kerridge for automotive companies like Nissan, TATA etc. with a team of 4 senior administrators planned and executed a 2 year long migration and standardization process. Managed design, implementation, testing and commission.
2.Centralized Domain Management.
Distributed nature of Alhamrani Network with 120 different sites made it difficult to manage the centralized Domain. Performed planning of domain structure, setups, and management of these Domain Controllers.
3.Sophisticated Centralized Email and Internet Systems. 
Different companies using different mailing systems that were migrated on one MS Exchange platform with 6 different exchange sites interconnected with one Gateway. Performed Planning, Setup, and management of the whole system (Exchange, mail storage and Proxy.)
4. PC and Software Standardization for end users
Planned the Implementation of Policies and Supervision of Setups. Every computer to have a standard set of software that includes Microsoft Office. Acrobat. Etc. with a standard look and backed up by Restricted Group Policies to avoid illegal software installation and computer misuse.
5.Strong Disaster recovery and end user’s Data Backup Strategy.
 Planning of Backup Strategy and Implementation group wide for users and data centers, daily, weekly, monthly backups with system state and incremental backups were automated on SAN storage locally and remotely.
6.Establishment of an organized Help Desk
Standardized the help-desk engineers to different geographical sites with a Support Engineer who would be responsible for the support of his region. As Technical Support Manager managed the Help Desk with a team of 19 engineers.
profile_positions.title: INFRASTRUCTURE and DATA CENTER RELATED
